data.title: Remove support for .NET 3.5 from make.ps1 since we need .NET 4 now
Ingame Map Editor : Add tooltips over actors and tiles
data.body:
I think there should be tooltips when the cursor hovers an actor or tile.
This will help recognize actors and tiles (some of them can look almost the same).

![screenshot002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2761736/5088e1e2-c9e0-11e3-8458-d2dbb569b62a.png)

data.title: Ingame Map Editor: Actor/Tile selection bug
data.body:
There is an Actor/Tile selection bug in Mailaender's ingame map editor.
1. Select an actor
2. use it on the ground
3. right click on an empty area
4. try to left click again to "draw" the tile (it won't work)
5. try to reselect the same actor in the list to "draw" the tile (it won't work)

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: Ingame Map Editor: crash after right clicking on the minimap
data.body:
OpenRA crashes if you right click on the minimap, in the Ingame Map Editor.

https://gist.github.com/x-a-n-a-x/11155120

data.title: Added SupportsMapsFrom to mod.yaml for all mods
data.body: This is for issue #5169

data.title: Including SupportsMapsFrom by default.
data.body:
Obviously `SupportsMapsFrom:` is not necessary for the default mods but we get a lot of errors that end up being this missing and we have to explain it over and over.

Usually mods are made by copy/pasting an existing one.
This line could then be explained instead of having to tell the mod maker to add a new line somewhere in the yaml and making it more complicated than it needs to be.

If they'd like to use their own modname / maps of course that would work the same.

data.title: Changed LobbyDefaults -> Shroud from true to false, for all four mods.
data.body:
Was asked by @Phrohdoh to do this.
This is for issue #5113

data.title: Disable shroud option in cheats menu does multiple things
data.body: The disable shroud check box in the cheats menu not only disables shroud but also disables fog of war and makes enemy cloaked units visible. Shouldn't these be separated?

data.title: Submarines can be detected using iron curtain and chronosphere unit selector
data.body:
Enemy submarines can be easily detected using the iron curtain and chronosphere unit selector. If there is a submarine underneath a tile, a red selection box appears. I was able to sink lots of subs just by shooting two torpedoes using force fire and quickly moving afterwards to avoid red retaliation.

![detect_subs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/2757240/b81f086c-c982-11e3-8f38-d4e936fe2d1f.png)

It is also possible to detect subs while placing a sub pen or naval yard, tiles where there are subs are painted red and the structure can't be placed. But since this is limited to areas around bases it may not be that important. This method however can be used anywhere on the map.

data.title: Ingame Map Editor: Snap next tiles to the ones that were already placed
data.body:
Currently tiles snap to a 16x16 virtual grid (I guess) but I think there could be an option to make next tiles snap on tiles that have been previously placed on the battlefield.

This would avoid these glitches:
![006feafc-c97c-11e3-98f3-2ef52a5e3c86](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2761563/2c4230a0-c9da-11e3-8725-8537fe6a03aa.png)

data.title: Ingame Map Editor: add a 4x4 temperate grass tile
data.body:
There is one for water, I think it will be useful to also have a 4x4 temperate grass tile.

![screenshot001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2756665/39659bb0-c97a-11e3-8513-d5fc582c0b26.png)

data.title: Beautified the trait documentation
data.body:
from a simple code block to a tabular view inspired by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/New-Lua-API I also sorted them by namespace, gave them (linkable) headers and tried to use non-technical type names where possible.

Preview: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits

data.title: Prerequisites to automated translation string extraction
data.body: separated from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5152.

data.title: Fixed Cyborg Commando walk/crawl sequences
data.body: ...and converted electro.shp to unittem.pal.

data.title: * Fixed Bug #5072: RenderLandingCraft doesn't do an IsInMap check
data.body:
I fixed a small reported bug where landing crafts in Red Alert mod extend doors when adjacent to a map boundary:

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5072

data.title: Added a harmless Dune 2000 sandworm
data.body: Well as you noticed: it does not do much. This mostly sets up the sequences, audio and adds an icon I created from promotional renderings. I have significant trouble getting it underneath units, which is required for any attack to become in line with the mouth animation.

data.title: Implement player name completion in chat
data.body: Like in IRC clients, it would be better if I could type the first two letters of a player's name and then press tab to get it completed. And team chat/all chat switch could be assigned to a different key.

data.title: Touch Input Support Issues In Windows 8.1
data.body:
The touch area is not properly functional. The cursor usually clicks on the far left edge of the screen. Tapping the far right edge of the screen causes a click to occur near the middle of the screen. Input area is probably not the same as the screen area.  Should behave as a left click when the screen is tapped. 
System: Windows 8.1

data.title: Mouse Input Frozen On Changing Apps Windows 8.1
data.body:
When OpenRA is minimized or ALT+TABbed out of, the mouse cursor is stuck at the upper left corner of the screen.
How to reproduce: Start the game. Do above or press WIN+D to go to Desktop. Game maintains control of mouse input. 
System: Windows 8.1

data.title: Added Tiberium crystals and refinery to Tiberian Sun
data.body: still a lot TODO.

data.title: Added the production bar edge fixes
data.body: thanks to @MicroGraphics followup of #5107.

data.title: BuildLimit causes prerequisites to be ignored
data.body:
To reproduce, put this in a map

```
Rules:
    TENT:
        Buildable:
            BuildLimit: 1
```

Load the map, deploy MCV. Notice that defenses are available despite not building TENT.

If you keep chaining buildings with BuildLimit: 1, every building is available (E.G. give a BuildLimit to every single building, and when you start the game they're all buildable).

data.title: Automated translation string extraction
data.body:
To quickly create and update GUI localisation. Creating this took me longer than expected. It is at an experimental stage where this should not yet merged. I already stumbled on some problems that might need discussion:
- Pretty long translation keys to avoid duplicates: OK_BUTTON, CANCEL_BUTTON etc. get prefixed with the container/background widget label. I already tried line numbers, but those are variable later on therefore maybe confusing and they still generated duplicates like L9_TITLE_LABEL-Text. We can also try to eliminate the redundancy at one stage, however I tried solving it manually and that is too much manual labor. Also the suffix may seem redundant, but that is required to differentiate multiple translatable texts per widget like READY/ON HOLD.
- You will notice a lot of noise in https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/commit/b083448ba4d8469000c26cdf25d151d45b9efda8 because for some reason we use `key: value` in rule YAML, but no space between `key:value` in chrome YAML. I can hack a workaround in here or we just auto-convert them to stay in line with YamlWriter.

data.title: Attempted to attach a panel to an open dropdown
data.body:
I opened Firefox browser while i was changing room settings, then i clicked the money drop-down list to choose 10k money, and then i clicked to my firefox window in accident (i think), and then it crashed:

`Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5477
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to attach a panel to an open dropdown
   at OpenRA.Widgets.DropDownButtonWidget.AttachPanel(Widget p, Action onCancel)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.DropDownButtonWidget.ShowDropDown[T](String panelTemplate, Int32 height, IEnumerable`1 options, Func`3 setupItem)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Widgets.Logic.LobbyLogic.<LobbyLogic>c__AnonStorey131.<>m__2D7(MouseInput _)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.ButtonWidget.HandleMouseInput(MouseInput mi)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleMouseInputOuter(MouseInput mi)
   at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.HandleInput(MouseInput mi)
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.<OnMouseInput>c__AnonStorey24.<>m__24()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.OnMouseInput(MouseInput input)
   at OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlInput.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler)
   at OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.SdlGraphics.PumpInput(IInputHandler inputHandler)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.EndFrame(IInputHandler inputHandler)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)`

All logs: http://www.speedyshare.com/U9EJV/panelattachcrash.7z

I cant seem to be able to reproduce this.

Oh, and in the room there was 1 other player when it crashed.

data.title: Moved CHANGELOG into GitHub wiki
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog

Benefits include:
- fewer merge conflicts, lowers the barrier to contribute
- easier to read because it is rendered as HTML here
- markup is already compatible with the website for quick release news

data.title: Make chat window not autoscroll
data.body: Chat history in the game keeps scrolling down when new messages arrive. This makes it harder to read previous messages if people are constantly typing things. The presence of new messages could be signaled in a different way, like a green down arrow or a message icon lighting up.

data.title: Converted INSTALL to Markdown
data.body: moved licensing information to the README as I believe this is also something the end user should be informed about and is not usually expected in an INSTALL file.
